import pandas as pd
import pandera as pa
import xarray as xr
import yaml

from abc import abstractmethod
from typing import Protocol, Any, Union
from dataclasses import dataclass, field
from os import PathLike
#import pandera as pa
#from pandera.typing import DataFrame



[docs]
@dataclass
class SystemConfiguration:
    """System-wide information used to configurate a :class:`~polimpact.protocols.SimulationSystem`.
    
    Parameters
    ----------
    begin : 
        When in time-dimension to start simulation (e.g., years).
    end : 
        When in time-dimension to end simulation (e.g., years).
    nsim : 
        Number of simulations.
    units : 
        List of units included (e.g., gwcodes).
    """
    begin: int 
    end: int
    nsim: int
    units: list[int] = field(default_factory = list)



StringPathLike = Union[str, PathLike[str]]
ConfigType = Union[str, PathLike[str], SystemConfiguration]



[docs]
def config_parser(config: StringPathLike|SystemConfiguration) -> SystemConfiguration:
    """Parses the simulation configuration file

    Parameters
    ----------    
    config : 
        Path to .yaml configuration file or a :class:`~polimpact.protocols.SystemConfiguration` instance
    """
    if isinstance(config, str):
        with open(config, "r") as f:
            return SystemConfiguration(**yaml.load(f, Loader=yaml.FullLoader))
    elif isinstance(config, SystemConfiguration):
        return config
    else:
        raise NameError("config must be a string path to your .yaml configuration file, or a SystemConfiguration instance")





[docs]
class Model(Protocol):
    """A basic interface for models used to indicate the required methods and data-types models in a :class:`~polimpact.protocols.SimulationSystem` should have.
    
    Parameters
    ----------
    outcome : str
        The name of the outcome variable. Must match with what is found in the data, and with other uses of this variable in the system.
    model : Any
        Any cross-sectional model of the outcome variable.
    """    
    def __init__(self, outcome: str, model: Any):    
        ...


[docs]
    def predict(self, data: Any) -> Any:
        """A predict method capable of getting predictions from the ``model``.

        Parameters
        ----------
        data : 
            Any data that fits with the model.
        
        Returns
        -------
            Outcomes for units in a cross-section in some format.
        """        
        ...




    


[docs]
class SystemNode(Protocol):
    """The ``SystemNode`` is the interface between a model and the :class:`~polimpact.protocols.SimulationSystem`.
    
    Parameters
    ----------
    name : str
        Node name
    model : Model
        The model
    input_data : pandas.DataFrame
        Suitable initialization data for the ``model``.
    schema : pandera.DataFrameSchema
        The expected inputs to the ``model``.
    """
    def __init__(self, name: str, model: Model, input_data: pd.DataFrame, schema: pa.DataFrameSchema):
        ...

        config : SystemConfiguration
            System configuration for the simulation, possibly in .yaml file.

    def update(self, current_result: xr.Dataset):
        """Updates ``data`` from simulated results collected by the :class:`~polimpact.protocols.SimulationSystem`
        
        Parameters
        ----------        
        current_result : xr.Dataset 
            A cross-sectional slice of simulation data.
        """
        ...




[docs]
    @abstractmethod
    def get_prediction(self) -> xr.DataArray:
        """Gets a prediction from the model given ``data`` and adapts it to the format expected by the :class:`~polimpact.protocols.SimulationSystem`"""
        raise NotImplementedError("Select an appropriate adapter for your model.")







[docs]
class SimulationSystem(Protocol):
    """The SimulationSystem collects node-predictions and distribute them.

    Arguments
    ----------
    initialized : bool
        Is the system initialized?
    nodes : list[SystemNode]
        A list of nodes
    config : SysemConfiguration
        System configuration details
    projection : xr.Dataset
        The data container for simulated data
    current_result : xr.Dataset
        A cross-sectional slice of the current data.

    """


[docs]
    def setup(self, config: SystemConfiguration|str):
        """Sets up all nodes for simulation and creates an empty ``projection`` container.
        
        Parameters
        ----------
        config : SystemConfiguration|str
            System configuration used to inform the simulation routines. Accept paths to .yaml files. 
        """
        ...




[docs]
    def add_node(self, node: SystemNode):
        """Adds nodes to the system.
        
        Parameters
        ----------
        node : SystemNode
        """
        ...




[docs]
    def get_predictions(self):
        """Saves predictions from nodes in the ``projection`` and updates ``current_result``."""
        ...




[docs]
    def update_nodes(self):
        """Updates nodes with simulated data from all nodes."""
        ...




[docs]
    def sim(self):
        """Simulates the system."""
        if not self.initialized:
            raise AttributeError("Initialize system first by running .setup()")
        current_time: int = self.config.begin + self.current_step
        for _ in range(current_time, self.config.end):
            self.get_predictions()
            self.update_nodes()
